you're watching a cop thriller and the

the writers hi when they came up with
these things the human tongue is covered
with tiny bumps called papillae which
contain the taste buds the average
person has around 10,000 taste buds and
each bud contains 50 to 100 taste
receptor cells these are tiny
microscopic hairs attached to nerve
endings which respond to chemicals in
the food and send messages to the brain
to tell us how something tastes there
are five types of receptors responsible
for tasting sweet sour salty bitter and
umami a savory flavor but it's a myth
that each type is confined to a
particular area of the tongue the
greatest density of taste receptors is
on the tip of the tongue so that area is
particularly sensitive to taste so are
we able to use the tip of this amazing
tasting organ to test for drugs
the simple answer isn't it firstly it
really isn't a very good idea to go
around sticking unknown white powders
into your mouth that's how people die
secondly while some people do reckon
that certain drugs such as cocaine
ketamine or MDMA have a distinctive
